intro: Vaccinium delavayi subsp. merrillianum, commonly known as the Yunnan huckleberry, is a shrub native to the mountainous regions of southwestern China. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many acid-loving plants. The plant produces small, edible berries that are typically dark blue or purple in color. It thrives in cool, moist environments with well-drained acidic soils. The subspecies is distinguished by its slightly larger leaves and more robust growth compared to other Vaccinium species.
